text: Alexander Sulkhanishvili () (born 1808, Tbilisi) was a Georgian translator and calligrapher of the 19th century. In 1825 he rewrote the works of Sulkhan-Saba Orbeliani. He also spoke Russian, Persian and Turkish languages. In 1828 he translated from Persian to Georgian the work of XV poet Panah, "Bakhtiarnameh". From the 1840s Sulkhanishvili lived in Saint Petersburg. In 1839 he published a Georgian-French-Russian dictionary. ==References== *Georgian Soviet Encyclopedia, ტ. 9, გვ. 602-603, თბ., 1985 *გვახარია ა., სპარსული ხალხური დასთანების ქართული ვერსიები, I — ბახთირ-ნამე, თბ., 1968 *რუხაძე ტ., ქართული ეპოსი „გარდამავალი ხანის“ ლიტერატურაში, თბ., 1939 Category:Calligraphers from Georgia (country) Category:1808 births Category:Translators from Georgia (country) Category:19th-century people from Georgia (country) Category:Writers from Tbilisi Category:Year of death missing Category:19th-century writers from Georgia (country) Category:19th-century translators
title: Alexander Sulkhanishvili
